intro: Bunium sogdianum, commonly known as the Sogdian fennel, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and feathery, finely divided leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Bunium sogdianum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its medicinal properties.
